translation.en: [Laura A. Ward] On December 16th, it was a holiday week. People were out Christmas shopping.
translation.ko: 연말 연휴인 12월 16일이었어요 다들 성탄절맞이 쇼핑을 했죠

translation.en: I was sitting in my windowless office, as I often did,
translation.ko: 전 여느 때처럼 창문 없는 사무실에 앉아서 "로라 A. 워드 연방 검사"

translation.en: working on the Castellano case.
[reporter] Paul Castellano's awaiting trial
in the biggest organized crime case ever.
A case that I'd worked on for almost a year.
[reporter] Charged with murder, extortion, drug smuggling and racketeering.
translation.ko: 살인, 갈취, 마약 밀수 공갈 혐의로 기소됐습니다

translation.en: Paul Castellano was considered the boss of bosses back in the '80s.
He was the boss of the biggest organized crime family,
translation.ko: "폴 카스텔라노" 가장 큰 범죄 조직 패밀리의 수장이었어요

translation.en: the Gambino family.
[reporter] Castellano left the federal courthouse in lower Manhattan tonight
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 카스텔라노는 보석금 200만 달러를 내고

translation.en: after posting two million dollars bail money.
[Ward] I thought we had a slam-dunk case,
and we were putting the final touches on it.
And all of a sudden, my phone started to light up.
-[phone ringing] -All my lines were lighting up.
[Eric Shawn] I was in the newsroom at Channel 11 at the time,
translation.ko: 당시 채널 11의 뉴스룸에 있었어요 "에릭 숀 폭스 뉴스 기자"

translation.en: and suddenly, the police scanner started screaming
about shots fired in Midtown.
[officer on radio] Shots from the street here around 5:20. One…
-[Shawn] Over on 46th Street. -[officer] Here on 46th street.
Right outside Sparks Steak House.
-[man 1] Is the man in the street now? -[man 2] He's lying by his car.
translation.ko: - 피해자는 그 자리에 있나? - 자기 차 옆 바닥에 있다

translation.en: [Shawn] Two people gunned down brazenly just after five o'clock,
translation.ko: 고작 5시가 조금 넘은 시각에 버젓이 두 명에게 총질을 했죠

translation.en: in Midtown during Christmas shopping.
[man on radio] The guys who did it, they looked like male whites.
All three had tan trench coats.
[Ward] The FBI agent said, "Laura, are you sitting down?"
translation.ko: FBI 요원이 이러더라고요 '로라, 놀라지 말고 들어요'

translation.en: And I said, "Is everything okay?" He said, "No. Castellano is dead."
translation.ko: 무슨 일 있냐고 했더니 이러더군요 '카스텔라노가 죽었어요'

translation.en: [reporter] Big Paul Castellano,
translation.ko: 미국에서 가장 강력한 마피아 보스 빅 폴 카스텔라노가

translation.en: the most powerful mafia boss in America, lies dead.
translation.ko: 미국에서 가장 강력한 마피아 보스 빅 폴 카스텔라노가 죽은 채 누워 있습니다

translation.en: Shot multiple times
as he was getting out of his limousine along with his bodyguard,
translation.ko: 리무진에서 내리던 중이었고 경호원인 토미 빌로티와 함께였습니다

translation.en: Tommy Bilotti.
I was floored. I just… I felt, "Oh my God."
A year's worth of work just down the tubes.
translation.ko: 1년 동안 한 일이 물거품이 된 거잖아요

translation.en: [reporter] The king is dead.
What the fuck happened?
That's a huge deal. That's like shooting the president.
translation.ko: "마피아 일인자 총격 사망" 대단한 일이었어요 대통령을 쏜 거나 마찬가지죠

translation.en: Who would have the balls to go kill boss of bosses?
translation.ko: 누가 보스 중의 보스를 죽일 배짱이 있겠어요? "안드레아 조비노 고티 준조직원"

translation.en: I call my captain, and I go, "Paul just got killed."
And he was, like, really calm, and he goes like…
"Eh."
The way his tone was… Like, I said, "Oh, shit," like.
And when I hung up the phone, I said, "Fuck, they fucking did it."
[Ward] So, within a few hours of the hit on 46th Street,
translation.ko: 46번가에서 살인 사건이 일어난 지 몇 시간 만에

translation.en: it became apparent to everybody
who had organized it, and that was John Gotti.
[reporter] The government says John Gotti is a cold-blooded killer,
translation.ko: 당국은 존 고티가 피도 눈물도 없는 살인자이며

translation.en: perhaps he most ruthless and powerful mob boss in America.
translation.ko: "감비노 조직의 새로운 대부" 미국에서 가장 무자비하고 강력한 마피아 보스라고 합니다

translation.en: Tell me about it.
John Gotti was a Marvel Superhero
translation.ko: "바버라 네빈스 테일러 WCBS 기자" 존 고티는 마블 슈퍼히어로였어요

translation.en: before there were Marvel movies.
He was the perfect character for the time in New York.
The mob is supposed to be a secret organization.
He flaunted it.
He played up to the camera.
He loved being in the limelight, and the public loved him.
translation.ko: 주목받는 걸 좋아했고 대중도 고티를 좋아했죠

translation.en: It made law enforcement look incompetent.
[Anthony Ruggiano Jr.] He didn't give a fuck about the FBI.
He didn't give a fuck if you got arrested, if you went to prison.
translation.ko: 체포되든 감옥에 가든 상관 안 했어요

translation.en: This was a slap in the face of the federal government.
[Ruggiano] He was a killer. He was a gangster.
We owned the fucking city.
[Ward] And now we were gonna try to take him down.
No other way to put it. Get Gotti.
[Andrea Giovino] New York in the '80s was a perfect time to be a criminal.
Like, you can get away with everything.
translation.ko: 무슨 짓을 해도 모면할 수 있었죠

translation.en: You've got away with murders, drug deals, extortion.
translation.ko: 살인, 마약 거래, 갈취 등 뭘 해도 괜찮았어요

translation.en: We owned New York.
There's nothing you couldn't get away with. Nothing.
We're making millions on the streets.
Everything was about mink coats, jewelry.
Everything about that reeked glamour.
-Yeah. -Wow.
People looked like, "This is unbelievable."
Who wouldn't want to be us?
Who wouldn't want to be a criminal?
John Gotti portrayed all of that.
translation.ko: 존 고티가 그 모든 것의 상징이었죠

translation.en: He was a man to be feared.
[reporter] There is a dragnet out for the hitman who executed mafia godfather
translation.ko: 마피아 대부인 폴 카스텔라노를 처형한 암살자를 위한

translation.en: Paul Castellano.
[George Gabriel] In 1985, I was about 29, 30 years old.
Had been on the Bureau for just about five years.
translation.ko: FBI에 근무한 지 5년 정도밖에 안 됐었죠

translation.en: The Paul Castellano homicide case, that's a really big deal.
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노 살인 사건은 정말 큰 건이었어요

translation.en: We're busy trying to see if we can make the case on the street.
translation.ko: 거리에서 사건을 해결할 수 있을지 분주하게 조사했어요

translation.en: We were fortunate that we had informants close to the inner circle
telling us that Gotti was behind it,
and many of the shooters who were involved.
The problem is they cannot come out and testify and tell the truth.
translation.ko: 문제는 당당히 나와서 사실대로 증언할 수가 없었어요

translation.en: You're gonna get exposed.
So it's, "Сan we find witnesses that will pick any of these guys out?"
translation.ko: 이 사람들을 골라낼 증인을 찾을 수 있는가가 관건이었죠

translation.en: People didn't talk. No. No way.
translation.ko: 사람들은 입을 다물었어요 절대 말 못 하죠

translation.en: Who's gonna say, "Yeah, I saw something"?
You'd have to be a moron because your days are gonna be numbered.
They're afraid. They know what the mob can do to them.
translation.ko: 마피아가 어떤 일을 할지 아니까 다들 두려워했어요

translation.en: [reporter] Not for 50 years has New York seen a mob murder
of this great a magnitude.
[Sal Polisi] When I heard about the 1985 Castellano assassination, the whack,
translation.ko: 1985년 카스텔라노 암살 사건을 들었을 때 "이탈리아 레스토랑"

translation.en: it had John Gotti written all over it, because that's who he was.
translation.ko: 딱 봐도 존 고티 짓이었어요 원래 그런 사람이니까요

translation.en: Gotti and I, we came up the ranks together through the '70s.
translation.ko: 고티와 저는 1970년대에 같이 조직 생활을 했어요 "대부 2"

translation.en: We robbed trucks together with Tommy DeSimone.
translation.ko: 우린 토미 디시몬과 함께 트럭을 털었죠 "토미 디시몬"

translation.en: The same Tommy that was in Goodfellas, the character Pesci played.
translation.ko: '좋은 친구들'에서 조 페시가 연기한 그 토미예요

translation.en: What do you mean, "Don't be like…"
Working your way up in the mob, you had to do a murder, something.
translation.ko: 갱단에서 위로 올라가려면 살인이든 뭐든 해야 해요

translation.en: And then you would be looked at like a potential made man.
translation.ko: 그래야 공식 조직원으로 보일 가능성이 있었죠

translation.en: John Gotti had a lot of guts, a lot of balls.
He was willing to commit a murder and not ask no questions.
translation.ko: 존은 기꺼이 살인을 저질렀고 아무것도 묻지 않았죠

translation.en: The boss tells you to do something, you do it.
[Polisi] James McBratney was a tough guy from Staten Island
whose crew was kidnapping Italian mob guys and holding them for ransom.
translation.ko: 그 조직원들이 이탈리아 마피아를 납치해서 몸값을 요구했어요

translation.en: So the word went out, and John Gotti got the assignment
translation.ko: 소문이 퍼졌고 이 맥브래트니를 죽이는 임무를

translation.en: to go kill this McBratney guy.
And John and two other people went out to Staten Island
translation.ko: 존과 다른 두 명이 스태튼섬에 갔고

translation.en: and killed him in the bar.
[reporter] The three men struggled with McBratney.
Then, with sudden fury, one, two, three, gunshots explode.
translation.ko: 갑자기 격분하여 총을 한 번, 두 번 세 번 쏘았습니다

translation.en: Jimmy McBratney is dead. The three men flee.
translation.ko: 지미 맥브래트니는 사망했고 세 남자는 도주했습니다

translation.en: John got arrested for it.
He went to jail. And he came out in '77. That's when he became a made guy.
translation.ko: 투옥되었고 1977년에 출소했어요 그때 공식 조직원이 되었죠

translation.en: [Ruggiano] He got straightened out. He got his button.
You know, he's a friend now.
There's all kinds of little slang things and terminologies,
translation.ko: 이 바닥에서 쓰는 은어나 용어가 많은데

translation.en: but they all mean he became a made member of a crime family.
translation.ko: 전부 범죄 패밀리의 조직원이 됐다는 뜻이에요

translation.en: He was projecting that he was gonna be the mob boss of New York,
translation.ko: 자기가 뉴욕의 마피아 보스가 될 거라고 하길래

translation.en: and I kind of laughed.
But John Gotti was much more clever than everybody realized.
translation.ko: 근데 존 고티는 모두의 예상보다 훨씬 더 머리가 좋았어요

translation.en: [reporter] Today, some law enforcement officials were quietly speculating
translation.ko: 오늘, 사법 당국 관계자 일부는 감비노 패밀리 내부에서 미국 마피아 최고 보스의 암살을

translation.en: that the hit on the top mob boss in America
translation.ko: 감비노 패밀리 내부에서 미국 마피아 최고 보스의 암살을

translation.en: was ordered from within the Gambino family.
[Bruce Mouw] For us in the FBI, that's very frustrating.
We knew who did it. We knew who ordered it.
translation.ko: 누가 한 짓인지 누가 시킨 건지 아는데도

translation.en: But yet, you have to try these guys in court and prove it.
translation.ko: "브루스 마우 FBI 감비노 팀 팀장" 이 사람들을 법정에 세워서 증명해야 했죠

translation.en: That's a big burden to overcome.
[Gabriel] We're not getting witnesses.
So, you know, we were desperate to try and build that case any way we could.
Remember that a crime family is like running a business.
translation.ko: 범죄 조직은 사업을 운영하는 것과 같아요

translation.en: They have to meet and discuss things, to collect the money, to send out orders,
to commit crimes.
We started surveilling John Gotti more and realized he was holding court
translation.ko: 우린 존 고티를 더 감시하기 시작했고 모임 장소를 알아냈어요

translation.en: at his club in Queens called the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club.
translation.ko: 퀸스에 있는 자기 소유의 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽이었죠

translation.en: [Ruggiano] Every mob family had a club,
and John Gotti had the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽은 존 고티 소유였죠

translation.en: My father took me there when I was 12 or 13.
translation.ko: 제가 12세, 13세 때쯤 아버지가 저를 거기 데려가셨어요

translation.en: And that's when I started to understand what my father did for…
translation.ko: 아버지가 어떤 일을 하시는지 그때 알게 됐죠

translation.en: You know, who he was, that he was mobbed up.
The Bergin Hunt & Fish Club, that was our office.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽이 우리 사무실이었어요

translation.en: We socialized, and we would talk about crimes.
translation.ko: 사교 활동도 하고 범죄 얘기도 나눴죠

translation.en: We started out our day in the social club, having some danishes and coffee,
translation.ko: 우린 그 사교 클럽에서 하루를 시작했어요 빵을 먹고 커피를 마신 후

translation.en: and then we pillaged and plundered New York City for the rest of the day.
translation.ko: 남은 하루 내내 뉴욕시를 약탈하고 돌아다녔어요

translation.en: [Mouw] You always wish you had a microphone,
because you see these guys going inside a club.
translation.ko: 이 사람들이 클럽 안에 들어가는 게 보이잖아요

translation.en: You know they're talking.
You wish you'd capture that conversation.
translation.ko: 그 대화를 포착할 수 있다면 정말 좋았을 거예요

translation.en: You know it's gonna be illegal. That's easier said than done.
translation.ko: 근데 그건 불법이에요 실행하긴 쉽지 않아요

translation.en: And one of the hardest things of this case was that every law enforcement agency
translation.ko: 이 사건에서 가장 힘들었던 점은 모든 사법 당국이 조금씩 맡아서 영광을 차지하려 했다는 거죠

translation.en: wanted a piece of it for the glory.
translation.ko: 모든 사법 당국이 조금씩 맡아서 영광을 차지하려 했다는 거죠

translation.en: So we had a deal with the police department, OCTF.
translation.ko: 조직범죄 전담반 경찰 부서 등과 거래를 했어요

translation.en: Everybody's out there.
[Frank O'Hara] The Organized Crime Task Force didn't have the resources the FBI had.
translation.ko: 조직범죄 전담반, OCTF는 FBI만큼 자원이 많진 않았어요

translation.en: The FBI was like the Third Marine Division.
They had the manpower. They had the money.
translation.ko: 인력도 돈도 있고 "프랭크 오하라 OCTF 수사팀장"

translation.en: They had everything you need.
Whereas the Organized Crime Task Force was more like a Seal Team.
translation.ko: 반면 조직범죄 전담반은 해군 특수부대에 가까웠죠

translation.en: We could do things a lot faster.
translation.ko: 우린 일을 훨씬 빨리 처리할 수 있어요

translation.en: [Ron Goldstock] We were small. We were nimble.
And we became competition for the FBI.
translation.ko: 그렇게 FBI와 경쟁하게 됐어요 "론 골드스톡 OCTF 국장"

translation.en: So the FBI, they suddenly decided to work very hard to catch up.
translation.ko: 그러자 FBI가 갑자기 열심히 따라잡으려고 했죠

translation.en: Our investigation put us one or two steps ahead of the FBI,
translation.ko: 우리가 한 수사 덕분에 FBI보다 한두 발 앞섰어요

translation.en: because our probable cause was developed,
and it enabled us to get a bug in the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club
seven months before Paul Castellano was killed.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽에 도청 장치를 심었죠

translation.en: In the '80s, when we tailed mobsters, it wasn't an easy task.
translation.ko: 1980년대에는 갱단의 뒤를 밟는 게 쉽지 않았어요

translation.en: From the time they left their house to the time they went home at night,
translation.ko: 집에서 나설 때부터 밤에 귀가할 때까지

translation.en: they were always looking, looking, looking.
But most people are creatures of habit, like John Gotti.
translation.ko: 하지만 대다수는 존 고티처럼 습관이 생기기 마련이에요

translation.en: He left his house about the same time every day.
He went to the same place every day,
the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club on 101st Avenue.
translation.ko: 101번가에 있는 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽으로요

translation.en: Because we knew that Gotti was an up-and-comer,
it struck us that this was a place to invest our time and money.
translation.ko: 시간과 돈을 여기에 투자해야 한다는 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: [Fred Rayano] We knew everybody else had tried to put the bug
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽에 다들 도청 장치를 심으려 했어요

translation.en: in the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽에 다들 도청 장치를 심으려 했어요 "프레드 라야노 OCTF 수사과장"

translation.en: The Queens DA's office and the FBI had failed.
So we figured we better be very careful.
[O'Hara] You had to realize
that you're in the neighborhood, and you're a stranger.
So you were kind of like a piece of coal sticking out of a cotton field.
I mean, you know, people were looking for surveillance.
So… I had to create a scene.
We had a detective routinely park a box truck
translation.ko: 형사 하나에게 버긴 클럽 옆 도로에 탑차를 정기적으로 세우라고 지시했어요

translation.en: along a street next to the Bergin Club.
translation.ko: 탑차를 정기적으로 세우라고 지시했어요 "버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 사교 클럽"

translation.en: And put cardboard out, so that the garbageman would pick it up.
translation.ko: 판지를 꺼내 놓고 쓰레기차가 수거해 가도록 했어요

translation.en: People would get used to seeing it.
And he would have coffee at the luncheonette across the street,
translation.ko: 길 건너편 식당에서 커피를 마시곤 했어요 "뉴욕 페이지 우주 왕복선"

translation.en: read the newspaper, get in his truck and drive away.
translation.ko: "1985년 4월 29일 월요일" 신문을 읽은 후 다시 트럭을 타고 떠나요

translation.en: So this became a routine that people became familiar with.
translation.ko: 그렇게 이건 사람들에게 익숙한 일상이 됐어요

translation.en: That must have taken a month or so.
There came the day we decided to go.
We had a guy that was great at picking locks.
Great at picking locks.
That afternoon, the detective put a refrigerator box out
translation.ko: 그날 오후 그 형사가 냉장고 상자를 꺼내서

translation.en: slightly near the door.
The idea of the box was, for anybody walking by,
translation.ko: 상자를 둔 이유는 지나가는 사람이 보기에는 그저

translation.en: it was an empty box against the building.
translation.ko: 건물에 세워 둔 빈 상자일 테니까요

translation.en: Inside the box…
is the lock man.
One side of the box was cut open.
As soon as the door was unlocked, he signaled us.
The entry team went to work to place the bugs in the place.
translation.ko: 진입 팀이 들어가서 도청 장치를 여러 개 심었어요

translation.en: I was a lookout.
I could see the front of the place.
[Rayano] The first thing you do when you're inside is survey.
translation.ko: 안에 들어가면 가장 먼저 훑어봐야 해요

translation.en: Where's the most likely place that people are going to gather,
translation.ko: 사람들이 가장 많이 모일 장소를 찾아야죠

translation.en: and you're gonna pick up their conversations?
There was a door leading to the back room.
Looked like a barbershop.
It was all set up with a regular barber's chair,
translation.ko: 일반 이발소 의자가 하나 들어가 있었는데

translation.en: with the phone right next to it.
Clearly, that's where John would sit.
I mean, knowing his personality. Everybody was below him.
translation.ko: 그 사람 성격을 아는데 모두 자기 아래라고 봤어요

translation.en: So we put a bug in there.
[O'Hara] They were inside for about 20, 25 minutes
when suddenly a car rolled past.
And they were sitting there looking at the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club.
translation.ko: 가다가 멈춰서 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽을 보고 있었죠

translation.en: This was a very precarious situation,
and I warned the team that
[through radio] somebody is suspicious and getting visits.
We heard somebody shaking the door.
Were they going to go in the place? Did they have guns?
I said, "Nobody move. We're the burglars."
"Let's see what they do."
[O'Hara] I decided to come out around the corner.
For some unknown reason, they followed me.
translation.ko: 무슨 일인지 몰라도 그쪽에서 저를 따라오더군요

translation.en: And they followed me for about three-quarters of a mile.
The entry team finished their job real quick.
And like thieves in the night, beat feet.
translation.ko: 밤에 활동하는 좀도둑처럼 빨리 자리를 떠났죠

translation.en: Now we've got the bug in.
We ran a hard cable to our analyst, Greg Stasiuk,
translation.ko: 우리 팀 분석가인 그레그 스타시우크한테 케이블을 연결해 줬어요

translation.en: so he can listen and extract the intelligence.
translation.ko: 도청을 듣고 정보를 캘 수 있도록 했죠

translation.en: [Gregory Stasiuk] One of the very first conversations I listened to,
all of a sudden, I hear them talking about killing someone.
I'm thinking, "Oh my God, I can't believe they're open about this. Amazing."
translation.ko: 이걸 대놓고 말하다니 정말 잘됐다고 생각했죠 "그레고리 스타시우크 OCTF 특별 수사관"

translation.en: [Stasiuk] But the sound just didn't sound right.
It just sounded kind of off, like it really wasn't right.
Then I realized no one was in the room.
The TV was on. And some mob movie was on. And it was just people talking on the TV.
translation.ko: TV에서 마피아 영화가 나왔고 배우들이 말하는 얘기였어요

translation.en: And then finally I heard the voice of John Gotti himself.
translation.ko: 그러다 마침내 존 고티의 목소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: And his voice has a presence.
[Stasiuk] The court gives us 90 seconds
to determine if the conversation is criminal or not.
translation.ko: 그 안에 대화가 범죄인지 아닌지 결정해야 해요

translation.en: And then we have to stop recording and stop listening.
translation.ko: 90초 후 녹음을 끄고 도청을 중단해야 하죠

translation.en: And then, after maybe two minutes, they go back on.
During those 90 seconds we would get him whistling or… Pretty boring stuff.
translation.ko: 90초 동안 고티가 휘파람을 부는 게 나오는 등 지루한 게 많았죠

translation.en: But you got some insight into him, even during those 90 seconds.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 90초 동안에도 고티의 특징이 잘 나타나요

translation.en: [Stasiuk] You can tell from the conversation,
everybody looked at him as an up-and-comer.
translation.ko: 다들 고티를 유망주로 생각한다는 게 보여요

translation.en: He was admired by his men.
[Ruggiano] He was always smart, sharp, funny.
He just had a presence about him.
It was like a moth to a flame. That's what it was like.
One thing you could tell is that John Gotti had a gambling addiction.
translation.ko: 존 고티가 도박 중독이 심하다는 걸 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: [announcer] The feature race, the eighth, and they're off.
[Stasiuk] The initial court order gives you the authority
translation.ko: 처음에 법원 명령을 받으면 30일 동안 전자 감시를 할 수 있는 권한이 생겨요

translation.en: to do electronic surveillance for 30 days,
translation.ko: 30일 동안 전자 감시를 할 수 있는 권한이 생겨요

translation.en: and then you have to renew it.
And you have to keep finding crimes in the conversations
in order to renew the electronic surveillance.
[Goldstock] The problem was, because Gotti gambled himself,
it muddied the waters as to what was legal and what was illegal.
It's not illegal to gamble.
It's only to run a gambling operation that's illegal in New York.
[announcer] …for 192 yards.
New England with two touchdowns within 15 seconds!
translation.ko: 뉴잉글랜드가 15초 만에 터치다운을 두 번 하네요!

translation.en: [Goldstock] We decided that it wasn't worth keeping the bug in there.
translation.ko: 그곳을 계속 도청할 가치가 없다고 결론을 내렸어요

translation.en: So we notified the court, and we stopped the bugging process.
There was nothing that we heard that would indicate
translation.ko: 우리가 들은 내용 중에 고티가 카스텔라노를 공격할 계획을 시사하는 건 없었어요

translation.en: that Gotti was planning an attack on Castellano.
translation.ko: 고티가 카스텔라노를 공격할 계획을 시사하는 건 없었어요

translation.en: [anchor] Our lead story is still that hit in Manhattan,
translation.ko: "1985년 12월" 오늘 머리기사는 여전히 맨해튼의 암살 사건입니다

translation.en: the execution of big Paul Castellano.
A Brooklyn funeral parlor is filled with flowers tonight
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 한 브루클린 장례식장은 카스텔라노를 추모하는 조화로 가득합니다

translation.en: for Castellano's wake,
and no doubt some sent by the man who ordered the killing.
translation.ko: 살인을 지시한 사람이 보낸 조화도 분명히 있을 겁니다

translation.en: [reporter] The speculation in law enforcement circles centers on the man
translation.ko: 사법 당국은 카스텔라노의 죽음 때문에 가장 큰 이익을 볼 듯한 남자를

translation.en: believed to be the person who would most profit
translation.ko: 카스텔라노의 죽음 때문에 가장 큰 이익을 볼 듯한 남자를

translation.en: by Castellano's death,
alleged Gambino family capo and possible successor, John Gotti.
translation.ko: 감비노 패밀리의 캡틴이자 잠재적 후계자인 존 고티죠

translation.en: [Ruggiano] After the hit, a week later, all the captains met.
translation.ko: 암살 사건 일주일 후 캡틴들이 다 모였어요

translation.en: They voted John in, and then John had a big Christmas party in the El Carib.
translation.ko: 존에게 찬성표를 던졌고 존은 엘 카리브에서 성대한 크리스마스 파티를 열었죠

translation.en: [Giovino] The best way I could explain it
is when the movie stars all wait for the Academy Awards.
translation.ko: 배우들이 전부 아카데미 시상식을 기다릴 때예요

translation.en: This is all the families, and everybody is waiting.
"Let's go, tonight's the big night."
[Ruggiano] And it was mobbed. You couldn't get in the door.
Everybody wanted to be up John's ass.
The whole family came. There was, like, 300 guys there.
I was included. And, you know, that's when he came out as the boss.
translation.ko: 저도 초대받았죠 그때 고티가 보스로 등장했어요

translation.en: He walked in like a powerhouse.
Shoulders back, very confident, very strong personality.
translation.ko: 어깨를 뒤로 하고 자신감이 넘쳤죠 개성이 강했어요

translation.en: And everybody was going over to him.
"Hey, John, congratulations." Kissing. Shaking his hand.
"Congratulations."
[Ruggiano] I was thrilled. He was in my neighborhood.
Now I had a good relationship with the boss.
You know, he liked me.
It was just a happy mood.
[reporter] Look at this man's face. He may already be the new godfather.
translation.ko: 이 사람의 얼굴을 잘 보세요 이미 새 대부일지도 모릅니다

translation.en: Lawmen believe he may have also been behind this.
translation.ko: 법조인들은 이 사건의 배후로도 보고 있습니다

translation.en: His name is John Gotti.
He is a member of the Gambino crime family,
the family that Castellano ran.
[Mary Murphy] When you see the mug shot, it stands out right away.
translation.ko: 머그샷을 보면 단번에 눈에 띌 거예요 "메리 머피 WPIX 기자"

translation.en: He was a handsome guy.
We start doing research.
We find out that he was a plumbing supply salesman,
translation.ko: "아크 배관 및 난방" 배관 용품 판매원이었다는 걸 알아냈어요

translation.en: according to his business card. Making $25,000 a year.
Yet he's riding around in a $60,000 Mercedes.
[Stasiuk] After Castellano and Tommy Bilotti were killed,
translation.ko: "대부가 살해되다" 카스텔라노와 토미 빌로티가 살해된 후

translation.en: we went back through our tapes to see if there was any information
translation.ko: 테이프를 다시 뒤져 봤어요 폴 카스텔라노와 토미 빌로티의 살인 사건에

translation.en: that would support John Gotti being involved
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노와 토미 빌로티의 살인 사건에 존 고티가 연루된 사실을 뒷받침할 정보가 있는지 봤죠

translation.en: in the Paul Castellano, Tommy Bilotti homicides.
translation.ko: 존 고티가 연루된 사실을 뒷받침할 정보가 있는지 봤죠

translation.en: [Rayano] Some of the recordings, the detective who was monitoring
translation.ko: 도청을 감시하던 형사가 일부 녹음 파일을 안 들린다고 표시했어요

translation.en: would mark them as inaudible.
translation.ko: 일부 녹음 파일을 안 들린다고 표시했어요

translation.en: So we had to go back and review all of those tapes,
-particularly the inaudibles. -[tape rewinding and stopping]
And that's where we started to put the pieces together.
translation.ko: 바로 그때 단서 조각을 하나씩 맞추기 시작했어요

translation.en: We recognized that early that summer,
there was a great deal of tension inside the Gambino family
translation.ko: 감비노 패밀리 내부에서 갈등이 컸다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: between Paul Castellano and John Gotti.
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노와 존 고티 사이에 말이죠

translation.en: Paul Castellano had an edict
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노는 마약 거래를 하면 죽는다는 명령을 내렸어요

translation.en: that if you dealt in drugs, you would get killed.
translation.ko: 마약 거래를 하면 죽는다는 명령을 내렸어요

translation.en: And that was the basis of John Gotti's problem in that early summer.
translation.ko: 그해 초여름에 존 고티의 불만은 그거였죠

translation.en: There was two guys in John's crew in the drug business.
translation.ko: 존의 부하 두 명이 마약 사업을 하고 있었어요

translation.en: One was his brother and one was his best friend.
[Rayano] Well, they were arrested and under indictment for drug dealing.
translation.ko: 둘은 마약 밀매 혐의로 체포 및 기소됐어요 "안젤로 루지에로"

translation.en: -Get out of the way. -Out of the way.
There was a standard code in the mob.
You weren't supposed to deal drugs, because you could get busted
translation.ko: 마약 거래는 하면 안 됐죠 체포되면 30년, 40년, 50년형을 받을 수도 있거든요

translation.en: and get 30, 40, 50 years.
Some of them will get life without parole.
translation.ko: 가석방 없는 종신형을 받을 수도 있어요

translation.en: So, that allowed the government to pitch those guys, like,
"You know what? You wanna do life, or do you want to come over
translation.ko: '종신형 받을래?' '아니면 우리 쪽에서 증인이나 정보원이 될래?'

translation.en: and become a witness or an informant?"
So, it was do the smack, get the whack.
And a lot of the guys followed the rules, and they didn't make any money.
translation.ko: 상당수가 규칙대로 했고 돈은 별로 못 벌었어요

translation.en: But you gotta realize, the young guys were making big money.
translation.ko: 근데 젊은 친구들이 돈을 많이 벌고 있었죠

translation.en: I was a drug dealer, and I was dealing heroin and cocaine.
Back then, I had 20,000 a week coming in. That was a fortune.
translation.ko: 그때는 일주일에 2만 달러가 들어왔어요 정말 큰돈이었죠

translation.en: Sal was the best coke connection I ever had
because he never charged me any money, and he always had coke.
translation.ko: 돈을 내라고 한 적도 없고 늘 코카인이 있었거든요

translation.en: Everybody was selling drugs.
There was a rule that was, on the down-low, nobody kept.
translation.ko: 관례가 있긴 했는데 암암리에 아무도 안 지켰어요

translation.en: Except guys like my father, old school guys.
Guys would come to my father with suitcases full of heroin,
translation.ko: 헤로인 가득한 가방을 들고 우리 아버지한테 와서는 이래요

translation.en: and go, "Andy, go make yourself a couple hundred thousand."
And he'd go, "I don't want that shit." I told him, "Take it. Are you kidding me?"
translation.ko: 아버지는 그딴 거 안 한다고 하셨죠 저는 이랬어요 '받아요! 지금 장난해요?'

translation.en: He said, "I don't want it. That's blood money."
translation.ko: 피 묻은 돈이라 싫다고 하시길래 제가 그랬죠

translation.en: "You're a murderer. You're worried about blood money?"
translation.ko: '아니, 살인자면서 피 묻은 돈 걱정을 해요?'

translation.en: He goes, "Because I'll be the guy they kill."
translation.ko: 아버지는 그러셨어요 '그자들이 죽이는 건 나일 테니까'

translation.en: "I'll be the guy they make an example out of."
[Rayano] John's crew recognized they were in dire straits,
and that day of reckoning was gonna come.
[O'Hara] John surrounded himself with some tough guys.
Because he knew what he was gonna do,
and he wanted to be strong.
And then, maybe a week or two before Paul Castellano was killed,
Paul overlooked John
and appointed Tommy Bilotti the underboss.
And that was the big mistake.
John's like, "What are you fucking kidding me?"
John thought he was the next in line.
translation.ko: 존은 자기가 다음 타자인 줄 알았어요

translation.en: [Ruggiano] As far as John was concerned, that puts the icing on the cake.
translation.ko: 존이 볼 때는 그 일로 정점을 찍은 거죠

translation.en: You know, now, if I'm John Gotti, I'm sitting back.
I say, "Look at this guy. He wants to kill my brother."
translation.ko: '이 자식 좀 봐 내 동생을 죽이려고 해'

translation.en: "Instead of making me the underboss, he made Tommy Bilotti the underboss."
"That means they're gonna come after me."
Paul Castellano knows John's a threat,
translation.ko: 폴 카스텔라노는 존이 위협적이라는 걸 알았고

translation.en: and he wants John out of the picture.
And makes a remark to somebody that he was gonna take care of John Gotti
translation.ko: 성탄절 직후에 존 고티를 처리할 거라고

translation.en: right after Christmas.
Now, John Gotti, he's a gangster.
John Gotti does not give a fuck about Christmas.
translation.ko: 존 고티는 성탄절 따위는 안중에도 없어요

translation.en: Now it's either kill or be killed. And that was it, that was the last straw.
translation.ko: 죽이거나 죽거나 둘 중 하나만 남았죠 그게 마지막이었어요 한계에 다다른 거죠

translation.en: [Stasiuk] There was one tape in particular recorded in June of 1985.
The audibility was not great.
We had heard it before, but we didn't pay too much attention to it.
translation.ko: 그 테이프를 이미 들었지만 그땐 대수롭지 않게 넘겼어요

translation.en: But now we listen to it again and again.
[Stasiuk] We were very excited.
Now we have that conversation now relating to a possible crime.
translation.ko: 잠재적인 범죄와 관련된 대화를 찾은 거죠

translation.en: Because in December 1985,
Paul Castellano and Tommy Bilotti are killed.
John Gotti became our main target.
[Gabriel] We're working the case on John, surveilling him.
translation.ko: 우린 존을 감시하면서 사건을 만들어 갔어요

translation.en: But John Gotti's not going to go out on the street and shoot anybody anymore.
translation.ko: 근데 이젠 존 고티가 거리에서 누굴 죽이진 않겠죠

translation.en: He's gonna tell people to do that.
That's the evidence I have to figure out how I get.
So, ultimately, you have to put a bug in on a guy like John Gotti
translation.ko: 결국 존 고티 같은 자를 도청해야

translation.en: to put these people in jail.
translation.ko: 이 사람들을 감옥에 넣을 수 있죠

translation.en: The intent was to try and put a bug in The Bergin Hunt & Fish.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽을 도청할 생각이었어요

translation.en: And we find out that the OCTF got into it before us.
translation.ko: 근데 OCTF가 우리보다 한발 앞선 걸 알았죠

translation.en: It's the price you pay for going after a guy like John Gotti.
translation.ko: 존 고티 같은 자를 좇을 때 감수해야 하는 부분이에요

translation.en: There's a lot of egos involved,
and other entities want to prosecute this guy.
It's a career case for a prosecutor or an agent.
Bruce had only one focus,
and that was the Gambino family.
There was nothing else in the world more important, and it was his.
translation.ko: 그보다 더 중요한 건 없었고 자기 사건이었어요

translation.en: And you didn't have any business in his backyard.
It was like, um…
They didn't like us. So we didn't deal with them,
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 우릴 안 좋아했고 그래서 상대 안 했어요

translation.en: and I'm not gonna go into it.
translation.ko: 그쪽에서 우릴 안 좋아했고 그래서 상대 안 했어요 그 얘기는 안 할게요

translation.en: So we were the only game in town in New York City at the time,
translation.ko: 당시 뉴욕시에서는 우리만 할 수 있었고

translation.en: and we were gonna go ahead with our own case.
[Stasiuk] On December 26, we're able to switch the bugs
translation.ko: 12월 26일에 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽 안에서 도청 장치를 바꿀 수 있었어요

translation.en: inside the Bergin Hunt & Fish Club back on.
translation.ko: 버긴 헌트 앤드 피시 클럽 안에서 도청 장치를 바꿀 수 있었어요

translation.en: And we were back up on John Gotti again.
translation.ko: 다시 한번 존 고티를 도청할 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Goldstock] And then we really hit the jackpot.
There we are, taking the conversations that no one else could possibly have
translation.ko: 고티가 보스가 된 후 며칠 동안 일어난 대화를

translation.en: within days of him becoming boss.
